item.title: Clarissa Asha add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Clarissa Asha add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Clarissa Asha add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Clarissa Asha add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "I solemnly swear that I am up to no good." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Clarissa Asha add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to our enemies, but just as much to stand up to our friends." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Clarissa Asha add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "To the well-organized mind, death is but the next great adventure." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Clarissa Asha add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Of course it is happening inside your head, Harry, but why on earth should that mean that it is not real?" -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Clarissa Asha add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "The truth." Dumbledore sighed. "It is a beautiful and terrible thing, and should therefore be treated with great caution." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Clarissa Asha add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Do not pity the dead, Harry. Pity the living, and, above all those who live without love." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Clarissa Asha add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Mr. Moony presents his compliments to Professor Snape, and begs him to keep his abnormally large nose out of other people's business. Mr. Prongs agrees with Mr. Moony, and would like to add that Professor Snape is an ugly git. Mr. Padfoot would like to register his astonishment that an idiot like that ever became a professor. Mr. Wormtail bids Professor Snape good day, and advises him to wash his hair, the slimeball." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Clarissa Asha add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Wit beyond measure is a man's greatest treasure." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Clarissa Asha add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "We are only as strong as we are united, as weak as we are divided." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Clarissa Asha add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "We're all human, aren't we? Every human life is worth the same, and worth saving." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Clarissa Asha add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Death's got an Invisibility Cloak?" Harry interrupted again. "So he can sneak up on people," said Ron. "Sometimes he gets bored of running at them, flapping his arms and shrieking..." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Clarissa Asha add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is the unknown we fear when we look upon death and darkness, nothing more." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Clarissa Asha add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Cinderella? Snow White? What's that? An illness?" -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Clarissa Asha add a quote by J.K. Rowling
Clarissa Asha add a quote by J.K. Rowling
Clarissa Asha add a quote by Gail Carriger
item.description:
"My <I>dearest</i> girl,' said the vampire finally, examining Lord Maccon with an exhausted but appreciative eye, 'such a banquet. Never been one to favor werewolves myself, but he is <I>very</i> well equipped, now, is he not?'
Miss Tarabotti gave him an arch look. 'My goodies,' she warned.
Humans,' chuckled the vampire, 'so possessive." -- Gail Carriger

item.title: Clarissa Asha add a quote by Karen Marie Moning
Clarissa Asha add a quote by Karen Marie Moning
item.description: "V'lane: Are you busy tomorrow MacKayla ? Barrons: She's working on old texts with me. V'lane: Ah. Old texts. A banner day at the bookstore. Barrons: We're translating Kama Sutra...with interactive aids." -- Karen Marie Moning

item.title: Clarissa Asha add a quote by Karen Marie Moning
item.description: "One day you do meet a man who kisses you and you can’t breathe around it and you realize you don’t need air. Oxygen is trivial. Desire makes life happen. Makes it matter. Makes everything worth it. Desire is life. Hunger to see the next sunrise or sunset. To touch the one you love. To try again." -- Karen Marie Moning

item.title: Clarissa Asha add a quote by Karen Marie Moning
Clarissa Asha add a quote by Karen Marie Moning
item.description: "Dying is overrated. Human sentimentality has twisted it into the ultimate act of love. Biggest load of bullshit in the world. Dying for someone isn't the hard thing. The man that dies escapes. Plain and simple. Game over. End of pain...Try living for someone. Through it all-good, bad, thick, thin, joy, suffering. That's the hard thing." -- Karen Marie Moning

item.title: Clarissa Asha add a quote by Karen Marie Moning
item.description: "I love books, by the way, way more than movies. Movies tell you what to think. A good book lets you choose a few thoughts for yourself. Movies show you the pink house. A good book tells you there's a pink house and lets you paint some of the finishing touches, maybe choose the roof style,park your own car out front. My imagination has always topped anything a movie could come up with. Case in point, those darned Harry Potter movies. That was so not what that part-Veela-chick, Fleur Delacour, looked like." -- Karen Marie Moning

item.title: Clarissa Asha add a quote by Karen Marie Moning
item.description: "Sometimes, Ms. Lane," he said, "one must break with one's past to embrace one's future. It is never an easy thing to do. It is one of the distinguishing characteristics between survivors and victims. Letting go of what was, to survive what is." -- Karen Marie Moning

item.title: Clarissa Asha add a quote by Karen Marie Moning
Clarissa Asha add a quote by Karen Marie Moning
item.description: "There are really only two options one can take toward anything in life: hope or fear. Hope strengthens, fear kills." -- Karen Marie Moning

item.title: Clarissa Asha add a quote by Karen Marie Moning
item.description: "One day you will kiss a man you can't breathe without, and find that breath is of little consequence." -- Karen Marie Moning

item.title: Clarissa Asha add a quote by Pearl S. Buck
item.description: "To eat bread without hope is still slowly to starve to death." -- Pearl S. Buck
